data.title: A nice mocha latte
data.text: A friend mentioned about this place so I tried it out.  Tasty mocha latte in a rainy day.  I think this is the place for a good drink and chat.  Not the type of place you come and work since the seating is limited, and very weak wifi.

data.title: Superb coffee and baked goods, lovely atmosphere
data.text: Probably my favourite A2 coffee shop, at least earlier in the day when the crowds haven't arrived. Get here when it opens or at least earlier in the morning and enjoy the space, the consummate skill of the barista, and the lovely airy and comfortable space. The coffee choices are thoughtful and delicious, pour-over very skilfully done, and the baked goods are superb. Far from the cheapest option, but you get what you pay for, and in this case it's a lot. There's a good reason this shop is packed in the afternoon! Make the effort to visit; you won't regret it.

data.title: Great Drink, Big Pricetag
data.text: We stopped here during a visit to The University of Michigan. The atmosphere was  pretty nice and had a new age vibe. It's definitely a small cafe with limited seating, and people vying for a place to sit. I ordered a mocha and it was excellent, with the added touch of latte art. However, the medium was only a 12oz and had a hefty price tag attached to it. If you're looking for an excellent cup of coffee, this place fits the bill. However, if you're on a budget, you may want to look elsewhere.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Tried the Lemonade with mint and it was delicious. At first you don't really taste the mint but it follows after. The Lab doesn't have much seating but the atmosphere is nice. I can picture myself there when there's too many people at Starbucks.

data.title: Wonderful Brown Sugar Sea Salt Latte
data.text: The Brown Sugar Sea Salt Latte is a perfect combination of sweet and salty with caffeine.  Service was friendly and efficient.  There's not too much seating, so we got our drinks in to go cups.  Tempting treats on the counter included a delicious soft peanut butter cookie, crackers, muffins, and a cherry/oat bar.  Definitely a nice addition to the Ann Arbor coffee options!

data.title: Huge profit margin for this owner...not much for the customer though.
data.text: Certainly nothing special. Stopped in for a mid-morning coffee for a meeting. Not ideal for a discussion.  $4.50 for a coffee with a shot? Starbucks, you have nothing to worry about. This place does not suffer for customers, too bad there is not much value...or atmosphere being provided for them. My suggestion is to pass on this cafe...keep walking.
